summary: Jacqueline Q. Ripple, an athletic trainer, was charged with unprofessional conduct, incompetence, habitual intoxication, and practicing under the influence of alcohol due to allegations of consuming alcohol on college property and while on duty, and failing to report a DUI arrest. She received a reprimand, a minimum six-month license suspension, and was ordered to enroll in the Maryland Professional Rehabilitation Program and complete a professionalism course.
